entries.title: US Supreme Court to consider religious discrimination case
entries.description: The case involves a postal carrier who says he cannot work on Sunday due to his religious beliefs.

entries.title: Brazil prepares to seek extradition of Bolsonaro ally from US
entries.description: Brazilian authorities are seeking return of former justice minister Anderson Torres as part of probe into Brasilia riot.

entries.title: US treasury secretary Yellen warns of hitting debt cap by June
entries.description: In a letter, Janet Yellen urged congressional leaders to quickly act to raise the debt ceiling.

entries.title: US President Biden to give State of the Union speech in February
entries.description: Biden will likely push for bipartisanship as he faces an empowered Republican majority in House of Representatives.

entries.title: Frene Ginwala: First democratic S African parliament speaker dies
entries.description: Frene Noshir Ginwala, called the 'torchbearer' of the post-apartheid parliament, dies aged 90 after suffering a stroke.

entries.title: Gas pipeline between Lithuania and Latvia blows up
entries.description: Fire put out at site of a gas pipeline explosion in northern Lithuania with no signs of attack or casualties.

entries.title: Peru attorney general launches investigations into protest deaths
entries.description: Probes will focus on deadly clashes at ongoing anti-government protests spurred by removal of ex-President Castillo.

entries.title: Sinking Himalayan town puts spotlight on India’s hydropower push
entries.description: Locals blame the damage on a hotel construction boom and tunneling for a nearby hydroelectric project.

entries.title: What’s behind finding of classified files in Biden home, office?
entries.description: It comes as an inquiry continues into former President Donald Trump's retention of classified papers.

entries.title: Canada imposes new sanctions on two ‘Haitian elites’
entries.description: Canadian government has accused two Haitian nationals, including associate of ex-President Martelly, of enabling gangs.

entries.title: Photos: Death toll expected to rise after tornadoes strike US
entries.description: The US National Weather Service received 45 tornado reports on Thursday, as violent storms whipped across the southeast.

entries.title: Tesla slashes prices globally by as much as 20 percent
entries.description: Price cuts challenge electric carmaker's rivals and reverse its strategy of past two years when orders exceeded supply.

entries.title: Apple CEO Tim Cook to take a more than 40 percent pay cut
entries.description: The compensation committee took into account shareholder feedback, company performance and a recommendation by Cook.

entries.title: Afghans condemn Australia’s boycott of men’s cricket team
entries.description: Afghan cricketers lead the chorus of criticism against Australia's decision to cancel a cricket series due in March.

entries.title: Iran’s top diplomat says talks with Saudis could restore ties
entries.description: Iranian foreign minister says he hopes diplomatic ties with Saudi Arabia can be restored after years of tensions.

entries.title: Biden hosting Kishida as US, Japan bolster ties in face of China
entries.description: Talks in Washington are part of Japanese prime minister's diplomatic blitz to boost partnerships amid China pressure.

entries.title: Trump Organization fined $1.6m for ‘brazen’ tax fraud
entries.description: The penalty is the maximum the judge could impose on the company, found guilty of 17 criminal charges.

entries.title: What does Russia’s military shake-up mean for the war in Ukraine?
entries.description: The appointment of Valery Gerasimov signals Moscow's failing war effort and fraught domestic politics, analysts say.

entries.title: Greek court rejects charges against aid workers
entries.description: Lesbos court says cases brought against two dozen people have procedural flaws.

entries.title: For Biden, probe of classified documents is a political snag
entries.description: Special counsels are investigating both Donald Trump and Joe Biden over their handling of classified documents.

entries.title: Sri Lanka to slash military by a third to cut costs
entries.description: The bankrupt country says it will reduce army personnel to 135,000 by next year and 100,000 by 2030.

entries.title: Belarus could join war if Ukraine ‘invades’, says Russia
entries.description: Moscow warns of 'collective response' to any attack on Russia or Belarus, as allies prepare to stage joint drills.

entries.title: Tunisia increasingly isolated under Saied as US loses interest
entries.description: The president has tried to look abroad to get the country out of its economic crisis, without much success.

entries.title: Iran praises possible rapprochement between Syria and Turkey
entries.description: Moscow supports Damascus-Ankara talks, which al-Assad says must lead to an end of Turkey's "occupation" of Syrian land.

entries.title: Drop all charges against refugee aid workers, UN tells Greece
entries.description: Syrian swimmer Sara Mardini and several other foreign and Greek refugee rescue workers are on trial in Lesbos.

entries.title: Amhara forces withdraw from northern Ethiopia’s Tigray region
entries.description: The Ethiopian army says Amhara forces have left war-torn Tigray in compliance with a truce agreed on November 2.

entries.title: Russia says its forces have taken control of Ukraine’s Soledar
entries.description: Moscow says its capture of the eastern town will enable Russian troops to envelop the nearby city of Bakhmut.

entries.title: Astronomers find Milky Way galaxy’s most-distant stars
entries.description: Astronomers found 208 stars of which the furthest is 1.08 million light years from Earth.

entries.title: Pro-government parties win parliament majority in Benin polls
entries.description: The two parties supporting President Talon together won 81 out of 109 seats.

entries.title: India urged to close airspace to Myanmar warplanes after attacks
entries.description: Fortify Rights said Myanmar's air force 'dropped bombs on both sides of the Myanmar-India border' in raids this week.

entries.title: Koblenz trial one year on: ‘It should have been in Damascus’
entries.description: The proceedings against Syrian regime officials in Germany were in no way perfect - but still a momentous achievement.

entries.title: Pakistan foreign exchange reserves drop to lowest since 2014
entries.description: Experts paint a gloomy picture, saying the government must reconsider its priorities.

entries.title: What’s behind the computer glitch that grounded US flights?
entries.description: Thousands of domestic and international flights were disrupted on Wednesday.

entries.title: S Korea police seek to charge officials over 159 killed in crush
entries.description: Inquiry finds officials in Seoul had failed to employ adequate crowd control for an expected Halloween crowd of 100,000.

entries.title: Hundreds rally against al-Shabab in Somali capital Mogadishu
entries.description: Somalia President Mohamud urges citizens to help flush out members of the group he describes as 'bedbugs'.

entries.title: Ghana increases salaries by 30 percent amid economic woes
entries.description: Inflation is hovering at a record 50.3 percent in Ghana, once described as Africa’s shining star by the World Bank.

entries.title: Japan prosecutors indict man for ex-PM Shinzo Abe murder: Media
entries.description: Suspect Tetsuya Yamagami, 42, was indicted on murder charges and violating gun laws for the shooting of Shinzo Abe.

entries.title: Turkey summons Swedish ambassador over Erdogan effigy protest
entries.description: Footage showed what Turkish media said was a protest by the PKK, in which they hung up an effigy of Erdogan.

entries.title: Seven dead in US South after severe rain, tornadoes
entries.description: Strong winds and heavy rain damage homes, tens of thousands without power in parts of Georgia, Mississippi and Alabama.

entries.title: CIA chief visits Libya after Lockerbie suspect handover
entries.description: William Burns makes a rare trip to Libya, meeting the country's interim prime minister and his rival, Khalifa Haftar.

entries.title: China’s imports, exports plunge in warning sign for economy
entries.description: Exports shrink 9.9 percent year-on-year in December, while imports decline 8.7 percent.

entries.title: Thai army kills 5 suspected drug smugglers near ‘Golden Triangle’
entries.description: Almost 500,000 methamphetamine pills found after clash between Thai forces and suspected smugglers in Thailand's north.

entries.title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 324
entries.description: As the Russia-Ukraine war enters its 324th day, we take a look at the main developments.

entries.title: US states Wisconsin, North Carolina unveil TikTok bans
entries.description: Moves come after US President Joe Biden signed law banning federal employees from using the app on government devices.

entries.title: Peru’s gateway airport to Machu Picchu closes as protests grow
entries.description: Safety considerations led to the closure of airport in Cusco, a gateway to Peru's tourism crown jewel of Machu Picchu.

entries.title: UK says Hong Kong freedoms continue to erode, drawing China anger
entries.description: Former colonial power in the territory says it is in China’s interests that Hong Kong maintain its distinctiveness.

entries.title: Lisa Marie Presley dies at 54 after suspected cardiac arrest
entries.description: Mother confirms death of musician and only daughter of rock 'n' roll legend Elvis Presley.

entries.title: ExxonMobil predicted climate change while downplaying risk: Study
entries.description: Texas, US-based company’s own scientists accurately predicted global warming as far back as the 1970s, study says.

entries.title: Japan says Fukushima water release to start in ‘spring or summer’
entries.description: Plan will see some 1 million tonnes of water used to cool the ruined plant's reactors released into the Pacific.

entries.title: IMF chief sees 2023 global growth forecast holding steady
entries.description: IMF Managing Director Kristalina Georgieva says 2023 to be another "tough year" for the global economy.

entries.title: ‘Extremely dangerous’ tornado tears across US South as storms hit
entries.description: The National Weather Service received 33 tornado reports across southern states like Alabama, Georgia and Kentucky.
